sub_title: Enterpreneur, Advisor, Supervisory Board Member of a Bank
summary:
Strategic leader and business development professional with over 25 years’ international experience in  private sector development and suistanable economic inclusion and diversity throughout Western Balkan and Europe including 18 years working for a range of high profile international organisations amongst them European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), UK Department for International Development (DFID), European Union, World Bank (South East Europe Development Programme)   From 2012 until July 2020 I was the National Programme Director (Principal Manager) responsible for delivery of EBRD SME Finance & Development Group activities in North Macedonia and a National team leader for implementation of Western Balkan Women in Business Programme financed by SIDA and Luxembourg. I was responsible for developing realistic but challenging annual business plans and leading the team to achieve them. Total programme portfolio consist of more than 1000 SMEs supported and more than 70 Market and Sector Development Activities undertaken.
In addition, I am a Senior Member of Rockefeller Brothers Fund’s Western Balkan initiative Philanthropy for Green Ideas supported by Balkan Green Foundation and RBF partners in Western Balkan.  In January 2018, I became an independent Supervisory Board Member of Capital Bank AD Skopje. 
I have been in particular highly efficient in establishing results driven communication with various stakeholders and international donors.
In observance of International Women’s day in March 2018, the US Embassy in Macedonia highlighted me as one of the 10 woman leaders in the country with a great contribution to the society and in particular for promoting women and youth entrepreneurship in the country

treasury_media.title: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD)
treasury_media.description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) helps businesses flourish. Through our financial investments, business services and involvement in high-level policy dialogue, we're well-placed to promote entrepreneurship and change lives.

Member of a team consisted of international and local private sector development experts from GHK International UK, Volunteer Oversee Services (VSO), Accenture and Cardiff and Vale’s Enterprise
•	Managing the department for Access to Finance and Business Planning services for SMEs. Assisted to more than 500 companies and acted as a trainer in more than 30 SMEs workshops. 
•	Assisting in raising funds from international development institutions (Oxfam, GTZ-DEG, IEP etc).
